archimate:Node.documentation:
Endpoint Devices
• Clinical Workstations
o Function: Primary computing devices for clinical staff
o Relationships:
 Used by → Nurse Stations, Clinical Areas  Access → EHR: Primary clinical application  Connected to → Access Layer: For network connectivity  Protected by → Endpoint Protection: For security  Managed via → Centralized Management: For updates and configuration
• Medical Devices
o Function: Specialized equipment for diagnostics and treatment
o Relationships:
 Isolated in → Medical Device VLAN: For security and reliability  Connected to → Medical Device WiFi: For wireless devices  Monitored by → Device Management System: For status and alerts  Send data to → EHR: For patient record integration
• Bedside Monitors
o Function: Patient vital signs monitoring
o Relationships:
 Located in → Patient Rooms: At point of care  Send data to → EHR: For automated documentation  Connected to → Medical Device Network: For isolation  Monitored by → Central Monitoring Station: For alerts
• Infusion Pumps
o Function: Controlled delivery of medications and fluids
o Relationships:
 Located in → Patient Rooms: At point of care  Connected to → Medical Device WiFi: For mobility  Report to → Medication Management System: For documentation  Protected by → Medical Device Security: For patient safety
• Mobile Devices
o Function: Portable computing for clinical staff
o Relationships:
 Connect via → Wireless Networks: For mobility  Access → Telehealth Platform, EHR: For remote work  Protected by → Mobile Device Management: For security controls  Secured via → Data Encryption: For data protection
• Medical Tablets
o Function: Purpose-built mobile devices for clinical use
o Relationships:
 Used at → Point of Care: For bedside documentation  Access → EHR: Primary clinical application  Connected via → Staff WiFi: For network access  Protected by → Mobile Device Management: For security
• IoT Devices
o Function: Connected sensors and automation systems
o Relationships:
 Connect via → IoT WiFi: Dedicated network segment  Managed by → IoT Management Platform: For configuration and updates  Send data to → Analytics Platform: For operational insights  Isolated from → Clinical Networks: For security
